H0.text: A vacuole is a cellular structure in an animal cell that helps maintain homeostasis by controlling the transportation of substances into and out of the cell.

H1.text: Cell wall is the cellular structure in an animal cell that helps maintain homeostasis by controlling the transportation of substances into and out of the cell.

H2.text: The mitochondrion helps maintain homeostasis by controlling the transportation of substances into and out of the animal cell.

H3.text: The cell membrane is the cellular structure in an animal cell that helps maintain homeostasis by controlling the transportation of substances into and out of the cell.

A4.text: The cell membrane is selectively permeable and able to regulate what enters and exits the cell, thus facilitating the transport of materials needed for survival.

A5.text: The cell membrane controls the movement of substances in and out of a cell, being selectively permeable to ions and organic molecules.
